TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a GPE national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( GPE ) . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant was the ex - wife and current unmarried cohabiting partner of CARDINAL Mr PERSON ( hereinafter Mr ORG ) . Mr ORG was born on DATE . He died on DATE from a gunshot wound sustained in a shooting incident involving police officers , in the course of which the applicant herself was wounded .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant and as apparent from documents submitted by her , may be summarised as follows .

ORG ( officier van justitie ) of ORG ( arrondissementsrechtbank ) of GPE ordered PERSON arrested on drugs charges . With the permission of ORG ( hoofdofficier van justitie ) it was decided that PERSON should be arrested without warning in his home in the town of GPE by a police arresting team . The reason was that Mr FAC was believed to be in possession of a firearm .
The arrest was planned for DATE . It was intended that Mr ORG house would be searched once Mr FAC was held .

The commander and members of the arresting team , all members of the GPE - Rijnmond police force , were briefed on DATE . They were provided with information concerning the suspect and shown plans and photographs of the house where he was to be arrested . They were further told that Mr ORG elder son , Mr PERSON ( born on DATE , sometimes referred to as PERSON ) , was also believed to possess a firearm .

The arresting team commander had the choice between a fast arresting procedure and a slower procedure . The fast procedure involved forcing an entry as quickly as possible and gaining control of all rooms in the building , pistols remaining holstered ; only when a pair of police officers entered the room which they were detailed to clear would the first officer , and only the first officer , draw his pistol . The slower procedure involved the use of bulletproof shields . It might , depending on the circumstances , involve entering the building with pistols drawn . If the faster procedure was used but difficulties were encountered , the slower procedure was resorted to . The arresting team commander chose the fast procedure .

TIME before the operation was to take place police officers undertook a final reconnaissance . It was established that the light was on in the hallway on the ground floor ; the front door was locked and in addition bolted at the top but not at the bottom .

The arresting team were dressed in dark blue overalls , bulletproof vests bearing the word “ police ” in large black letters on a light - coloured reflecting background and bulletproof helmets with visors . They were equipped with electric torches and the standard police issue PERSON PCARDINAL pistol . The pistols were loaded with standard police issue Action CARDINAL ammunition .
The arresting team was comprised of QUANTITY police officers . Their names have been withheld from the public and they are referred to by code numbers .

The team was divided into pairs , each detailed to search a particular part of the house , leaving CARDINAL member who would guard the back of the house . The first pair to enter the house would consist of Police Officers CARDINAL and CARDINAL , who would then proceed to the back bedroom on the first floor where FAC was expected to be .
Shortly after the team arrived outside the ORG home the commander was informed that there was light at the back of the house . However , this did not lead him to decide to use the slower procedure .

At TIME the front door of the house was stove in with a steel battering ram . This seems to have taken CARDINAL blows . The arresting team shouted “ police , police ” ( politie , politie ) in a loud voice .

Police Officers CARDINAL and CARDINAL entered the house and stormed up the stairs , Police Officer CARDINAL leading . He had his hand on the butt of his pistol and the holster open , ready as instructed to draw once he had reached the room which he was appointed to clear . Shining his torch up the stairs he saw a man and a woman standing on the landing .

Police Officer CARDINAL states that he saw the man – whom he recognised as Mr FAC , the suspect he had come to arrest – holding a silver - coloured object in his hand , and that he ( i.e. Police Officer CARDINAL ) then drew his service pistol . He saw Mr FAC push the woman aside and stretch the arm holding the silver - coloured object towards him . At this point Police Officer CARDINAL identified the silver - coloured object as a firearm . There being no time to take cover , Police Officer CARDINAL fired .
Police Officer CARDINAL too states that he saw Mr FAC holding an object that looked like a firearm .
The arresting team members , when questioned afterwards , all stated that CARDINAL shots were fired . The applicant states that it is possible , even likely , that CARDINAL shots were fired .

CARDINAL bullet struck Mr FAC in the right side of the chest , running towards the left side and slightly towards the head , perforating the right chest cavity , the midriff , the right lobe of the liver , the spine ( tenth thoracic vertebra ) , the left chest cavity and the lower lobes of both lungs and causing death by massive internal bleeding . The bullet was afterwards found in subcutaneous muscle on the left side towards the back , outside the chest cavity .
Another bullet penetrated the applicant 's left arm .

In accordance with instructions previously given for an eventuality such as this , Police Officer DATE called for a bulletproof shield , which was given him . He crouched behind it on the stairs , pointing his service pistol towards the landing . The police officers then ordered everyone upstairs to come down with their hands up .

The first to come down was the younger son of Mr FAC and the applicant , PERSON ( born on DATE ) , followed by their elder son , PERSON and their daughter , PERSON ( born on DATE ) . The applicant followed . The CARDINAL women indicated in loud tones that Mr FAC was upstairs wounded .

Another person found in the house was PERSON brother , PERSON Giovanni Adelberto de Pool . He had been sleeping on the settee , in the lounge on the ground floor . He had witnessed the police officers breaking down the door and entering the house .

CARDINAL members of the arresting team , Police Officers DATE and CARDINAL , then went upstairs . They found Mr ORG slumped in the bathroom and obviously severely injured but they did not find any weapon . Police Officer CARDINAL asked for an ambulance to be called , which was done . The police officers made an attempt to bandage the gunshot entry wound and staunch the bleeding .

According to the ambulance journey form , the call was received at CARDINAL a.m. ; the ambulance DATE based in GPE DATE set off at TIME and reached the address given ( which was QUANTITY distant ) TIME ; and the ambulance crew reached the patient at TIME , after having been shown upstairs by the police officers present . They found Mr FAC being supported upright by police officers but unresponsive . Attempts were made to revive Mr ORG , including by heart massage and by applying a saline drip to counter shock , but these were unsuccessful . Life was found to be already extinct .

A second ambulance was called for the applicant . Its journey form states that the order to move was received at TIME This ambulance , which had to come from the neighbouring town of GPE , set off at TIME and reached the applicant at TIME It set off with the applicant at TIME and reached the Zuiderziekenhuis hospital in GPE at TIME The applicant was found to have sustained a gunshot wound to the left arm ; treatment administered by the ambulance crew was to dress the wound and apply an intravenous drip of fentanyl ( a powerful pain killer ) .
The remaining members of the De Pool family were taken to GPE police station . The arresting team were relieved by police belonging to the regular GPE - Rijnmond force .

Later , the house was searched under the supervision and authority of an investigating judge . The search yielded several firearms and some live ammunition . CARDINAL of the weapons found was a small silver and black automatic pistol bearing traces of blood later identified as that of Mr FAC . It had been lying on top of a wardrobe located on the landing , close to where Mr ORG had been wounded . It had been loaded with CARDINAL live rounds and ready to fire .

The members of the arresting team all handed in their service weapons to officers of the GPE - Rijnmond police force . It was later recorded that , of the QUANTITY police pistols , CARDINAL were loaded with the regulation CARDINAL rounds ; DATE that issued to Police Officer DATE held CARDINAL rounds ; and CARDINAL held CARDINAL rounds instead of the normal CARDINAL .

Later on DATE ORG requested ORG ( Rijksrecherche ) , a police force nominally answerable directly to the Minister of ORG and placed under the primary collective responsibility of ORG to ORG whose duties included investigating cases of police firearms use with possible criminal - law implications , to investigate the events surrounding the death of PERSON and the wounding of the applicant .

ORG officers to whom the investigation was entrusted were CARDINAL detective chief inspectors ( hoofdinspecteurs van politie ) , PERSON and PERSON . Their official record states that they were at NORP police station , being informed by Inspector PERSON of the local police force , by TIME They investigated the De Pool residence TIME , at CARDINAL .
In the course of DATE police officers of the GPE - Rijnmond police force took statements from CARDINAL residents of houses adjacent to the ORG residence .

All had been woken by the noise . All but CARDINAL described hearing shouts of “ police , police ” and the noise of the front door being stove in . Some described hearing shots , although the number of shots claimed to have been heard varied : CARDINAL claimed to have heard CARDINAL shots , CARDINAL claimed to have heard CARDINAL , and CARDINAL estimated the number of shots at CARDINAL .

The CARDINAL members of the arresting team were questioned by ORG and PERSON on various dates DATE and DATE . The last to be questioned was Police Officer DATE ; he was heard under caution as a suspect .
The members of the arresting team made detailed and largely consistent statements describing the preparation and execution of the arrest operation .

Those who were inside the house at the time of the shooting describe hearing Police Officer CARDINAL call out that there is a silver - coloured ( according to CARDINAL account : a chrome - coloured ) pistol . None describe hearing CARDINAL shots fired .
Several members of the arresting team describe attending a discussion or debriefing at GPE police station after withdrawing from the scene of the incident .

The crew of the first ambulance – a driver and a nurse – were questioned by ORG and GPE on DATE respectively . They described the members of the arresting team taking them into the bathroom where they had found Mr FAC being attended to by CARDINAL police officers . Mr FAC had been handcuffed and sitting in a slumped position . He had been unresponsive .

There had been a bullet entry wound but no exit wound . There had been no pupil reflex and no blood pressure . The heart monitor had shown a post - mortal pattern . Attempts to revive the patient , by heart massage and by applying a saline intravenous drip , had come to nought .
The applicant was questioned in her capacity of complainant ( aangeefster ) on DATE by ORG and PERSON .

The applicant had married Mr R.C. de Pool in DATE on the island of GPE ( GPE ) . She had divorced him in DATE but the relationship had been resumed as a non - marital CARDINAL in DATE . She and Mr de Pool had CARDINAL children , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON . The family had moved from GPE to the GPE in DATE and had settled in the town of GPE . Cohabitation between the applicant and PERSON had been intermittent and PERSON had served several prison sentences .

During TIME CARDINAL DATE the applicant had been asleep in bed , in the same bedroom as Mr FAC . She had been woken up by a sound of banging and breaking glass which she had identified as coming from the front door . After leaving her bed , she had stood on the landing , calling out : “ Who is there ? What is happening ? ” several times . Mr ORG had been standing next to her . She had heard , and then seen , a person coming up the stairs in the dark . This person had been dressed in black and wearing a helmet ; as far as she could remember , this person had not had a torch . This person had started shooting immediately from halfway up the stairs . She had heard CARDINAL shots in rapid succession and seen the muzzle flashes , which had been directed towards Mr FAC and herself . She estimated the time that elapsed between the sound of banging and the shooting at TIME .

The children had appeared as CARDINAL more persons dressed in black and wearing helmets had come upstairs . It was then that the applicant had first seen the word “ police ” printed in large letters on the clothing of the first of these persons , and understood that they were officers of the law ; however , she still did not understand why they had fired at her .

The applicant had been led downstairs . She had repeatedly asked for medical assistance for herself and Mr R.C. de Pool . The first ambulance had been very slow in arriving . Its crew had gone upstairs .
When the second ambulance arrived , the applicant had been laid out on a stretcher , carried to the ambulance and given emergency treatment , after which she had been taken to a hospital in GPE .
At the hospital she had received further treatment and been informed that Mr R.C. de Pool was dead .

DATE , DATE , she had discharged herself from hospital after consulting with the doctor who had treated her . She and PERSON had been taken under police escort to view Mr FAC body at the undertakers ' – no one else had been given permission to see it – and the body had been transferred to her custody for disposal .
The body of Mr R.C. de Pool had been transferred to ORG on DATE and buried there DATE .

The applicant had been told while still in hospital that firearms had been found during a search of the house . She had not at any time seen one in the hands of Mr R.C. de Pool ; as to any other firearms , she did not wish to make any statement without having seen her lawyer .

She had come to the conclusion that the police officer concerned had deliberately fired at her with intent to cause her grievous bodily harm or kill her . She had not given him any cause to use violence . In fact , she had intended to reason with him . She had not had any idea that the persons who had broken into her house were police officers ; she had thought that she was being murdered . She had suspected that these persons were a gang of criminals dressed in police uniforms . She had not at any time heard them call out “ Police , police ” , either before the shots were fired or afterwards .

The applicant had not been shown an arrest or search warrant . She therefore wished to make a criminal complaint of murder or manslaughter and causing grievous bodily harm against the person who had fired , and also of theft committed in the course of the search ; after all , she was not a suspect .

She also wished to know what had happened in the bathroom from the moment when PERSON was left alone there with the police officers . Upon her return in her house , she had found much blood on the floor of the bathroom , traces of blood on the walls , the rail of the shower curtain torn down and the shower curtain , all bloody , folded up in the corner . She had also found a towel covered in blood .

The applicant herself was still in pain from her wound , which was also causing her difficulties in her DATE life . The CARDINAL elder children had gone to ORG to recover , the youngest was staying with family in order not to miss school .
The applicant was questioned a second time , this time by Detective Chief Inspector PERSON in the presence of Detective Chief Inspector PERSON , a police officer also assigned to ORG , on DATE .

The applicant repeated that at the time of the shooting incident she had not seen a firearm on the landing or in the immediate vicinity of Mr R.C. de Pool . She did not know how it was that a firearm had been found in her house . Nor could she account for the presence of blood , presumably PERSON , on the weapon . She declined to say anything further on this subject .
PERSON , the daughter of the applicant and PERSON , was questioned on DATE at TIME by Detective Chief Inspectors Luijken and GPE .

The previous night she had been asleep in her bedroom . She had been woken up at TIME by a loud banging sound . Shortly afterwards she had heard a large number of reports in rapid succession . She had got out of bed and opened the door of her bedroom . She had seen her mother ( the applicant ) lying on the landing right in front of the stairs leading downwards and her father lying in the shower , which was QUANTITY away from the stairs . Her father had initially been lying face down , but had turned onto his back and looked in her direction . He had then closed his eyes and turned his head .

PERSON had been on her knees next to her father in the shower supporting him . She had however quickly been dragged away by CARDINAL of the persons in blue and taken downstairs . During the short time when she had been with her father he had not spoken , he had been unresponsive . The light in the shower had been on .
PERSON remembered hearing CARDINAL or more shots fired in quick succession .

PERSON was left with questions about the need for the police to force their way into the house and fire at her parents . She was not aware that her father did anything illegal . She was angry about the time taken by the ambulance to arrive . She knew nothing about firearms found in the house .
Detective Chief Inspectors Luijken and PERSON questioned PERSON a second time on DATE .
She supplemented her earlier statement with further detail .

PERSON had not seen or handled any firearms in the course of the incident but she was used to the presence of firearms in the house . Her father had always carried one , and had often given one in her safekeeping . DATE , CARDINAL DATE , she and her father had gone out together and she had been carrying what she described as a small type of pistol . At her father 's request she had shown the pistol to a waiter in a restaurant .
PERSON was questioned a third time on DATE , this time by Detective Chief Inspectors PERSON and PERSON .

She did not remember the waiter to whom she had shown the pistol on DATE . She recognised firearms on photographs which were shown her as weapons which she had seen in the house ; they might have belonged to her late father or her brother . However , these pictures did not show the pistol which she had shown to the waiter .
She did not know whose pistol it was which was found on top of the first - floor wardrobe , nor could she explain how it had come to be there .

Mr PERSON , brother of Mr FAC , was questioned on ORG by Detective Chief Inspector PERSON in the presence of Detective ( landsrechercheur ) PERSON who was assigned to the Curaçao Procurator General 's Department ( parket van PERSON in GPE ) .
On TIME CARDINAL he had been sleeping on the settee in the lounge of his brother 's house in GPE . Before going to sleep he had bolted the outside door .

He had been woken up by CARDINAL or CARDINAL loud bangs against the front door . He had jumped up from the settee . He had seen several individuals crawl into the house through the opening left by the broken pane in the lower panel of the front door . He remembered QUANTITY persons dressed in black wearing headgear . He had called out : “ Who are you ? ” but received no answer . These persons had moved towards the staircase in a crouched position . Having reached the staircase , they had then stood up and pointed pistols upstairs . He had taken them for armed robbers and fearing for his life had not dared to act . Up to this point the events had taken a minute at most .

The first of these persons , whom Mr PERSON remembered as a fat man , had pointed his pistol up the stairs . Mr FAC had concentrated on him because the others had gone upstairs . Mr FAC had heard CARDINAL loud reports which he had taken to be pistol shots . He had moved to a better vantage point from which to see what was happening and had heard PERSON and PERSON shout : “ You lot are bastards ” ( PERSON gemeen ) .

The fat man had then turned towards Mr FAC . It was only now that Mr FAC had been able to read the word “ police ” on his black clothing .

Afterwards Mr FAC and Mr PERSON had been taken to the police station , where the handcuffs had been removed , and kept there for TIME . Mr FAC had then been allowed to leave but not to return to his brother 's house , which was being searched .
Upon being released , at TIME , Mr FAC had telephoned relatives in GPE from a public telephone box and told them what had happened . He had not then been informed that his brother was dead .

Detective Chief Inspector showed Mr ORG a photograph of a revolver which had been found in PERSON room . Mr ORG stated that he had seen a weapon rather like that in PERSON room but had never seen his brother with a firearm .
Mr PERSON was questioned on GPE by Detective Chief Inspector PERSON in the presence of ORG on DATE .

On TIME CARDINAL Mr PERSON had been asleep in his room in the attic of the house . He had been woken up by a loud bang and shouting . His first thought had been that PERSON was having an epileptic fit .

Both were injured , his mother in the left arm and his father in the right - hand side of his chest . His father 's injury had bled less than his mother 's . His father had stood in the door opening of the bathroom , supporting himself against the door posts . He had seen his father sink to the floor , sit down and lie back slowly on the floor of the bathroom . PERSON had gone up to him and knelt by his side , holding him in a sort of embrace .

Looking downstairs , Mr PERSON had seen CARDINAL objects which he described as screens with spyholes which were marked “ police ” . Behind these screens there had been CARDINAL persons armed with pistols which they had kept aimed at the first floor landing . He had then realised that there were police officers in the house and that the reports which he had heard in relation to his parents ' injuries must have been pistol shots .
He had then heard shouts of “ Police , come downstairs ” . This was the first time that he had heard these persons identify themselves as police .
The whole incident had taken TIME up to this point .

Immediately afterwards Mr PERSON and Mr ORG had been taken to the police station . Mr PERSON had been asked whose the firearms were which had been found in his bedroom . He had denied all knowledge . He had then been formally arrested . TIME later he had asked after his family . A police officer called PERSON had said to him bluntly : “ Well my lad , I 'll tell you in telegramese . Your father has died . So whose are the guns ? ” ( Jongen , ik zal het in telegramstijl vertellen . PERSON vader is overleden en van wie zijn de wapens ? )
Mr PERSON had not seen his father or any other member of the family with a firearm ; nor had he seen one at all , or wielded CARDINAL himself during the incident .

He did not , however , recognise the silver - coloured pistol of which he was shown a photograph and had no idea whose it might be .
